articles.title: Greetings to Emir of Kuwait
articles.content:
Greetings to Emir of Kuwait
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Sheikh Sabah Al－Ahmad Al－Jaber Al－Sabah, emir of Kuwait, on the occasions of the 52nd anniversary of its independence and the 22nd anniversary of its liberation.
					 He expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would steadily grow in the future, too, and sincerely wished the emir and the people of Kuwait greater success in the work for the prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Kuwait
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Kuwait
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim Sunday sent a message of greeting to Jaber Al Mubarak Al Hamad Al Sabah, prime minister of Kuwait, on the occasions of the 52nd anniversary of its independence and the 22nd anniversary of its liberation.
					 He sincerely wished the prime minister greater success in the work for the country's economic development and prosperity, people's wellbeing in the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow.

articles.title: Greetings from Equatorial Guinean Political Party Leader
articles.content:
Greetings from Equatorial Guinean Political Party Leader 
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Feb. 16 received a message of greeting from Lucas Nguema Esono, general secretary of the Democratic Party of Equatorial Guinea.
					 The message said that the party members and supporters are pleased to extend the warmest and sincerest congratulations to Kim Jong Un on behalf of Obiang Nguema Mbasogo, founder and close member of the party political organization, on the occasion of Feb. 16, 2013, the 71st birth anniversary of Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people.
					
					 The message wished Kim Jong Un great success in his important work for the prosperity of the Korean people, the closest friends. 
					
					 It sent highest regards to Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test Tour Pyongyang
articles.content:
Contributors to Successful Nuclear Test Tour Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Scientists, technicians, workers, and officials in the field of defense science and soldier-builders who made contributions to the successful third underground nuclear test visited the National Gifts Exhibition House and the Pyongyang Folklore Park Sunday.
					 When they arrived there, officials, lecturers and employees warmly greeted them with bouquets.
					
					 At the exhibition house, they were briefed on the fact that the exhibition house was successfully built as a grand treasure house praising Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and edifices housing eternal assets of the sun's nation thanks to the ardent reverence of the army and people of the DPRK for them.
					
					 At the general review room they paid tribute to statues of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They went round with deep emotion the gifts presented to the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu by service personnel and people of the DPRK, overseas Koreans and south Koreans of all social standings.
					
					 Then they visited the Pyongyang Folklore Park.
					
					 They looked round historic buildings, relics and remains, being briefed on the fact that the park dealing with the history of the Korean nation spanning 5 000 years was successfully built.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Lee Myung Bak of His Crimes Committed during His Office
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Lee Myung Bak of His Crimes Committed during His Office 
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea has allowed outside forces to strengthen their domination over south Korea and made south Korea increasingly dependent upon them, kowtowing to the U.S. and Japan as his masters during five years of his office. He has stood in the way of achieving the reunification of the country, hurting the dignity and interests of the nation. These are the hideous crimes he has to pay for without fail. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Sunday says this in a bylined article. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The successive rulers of south Korea without exception pursued a policy of sycophancy and dependence towards outside forces, betraying the nation. But, Lee put all other traitors into the shade in servility, base nature and treachery. 
					
					 Citing facts to prove the crimes he has committed against the nation during his office, the article goes on:
					
					 These traitors forsaken by the nation are bound to be cursed and condemned even after their deaths. 
					
					 The end of the Lee group of traitors has come. 
					
					 All Koreans will never pardon Lee for his flunkeyism and treachery but mete out a stern punishment to him with pent-up grudge and resentment.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun No One Can Violate DPRK's Right to Sovereignty
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun No One Can Violate DPRK's Right to Sovereignty
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's satellite launch and nuclear test were an exercise of its legitimate right and a measure taken for just self-defense, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in a bylined article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The right to launch a satellite for peaceful purposes is the universally accepted right which any country of the world is entitled to exercise.
					
					 The DPRK's launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 deserves praise, far from being problematic from the viewpoint of international law and in the light of the trend of the times when countries are making progress by dint of science and technology.
					
					 Nevertheless, the right of the DPRK to launch satellites for peaceful purposes was wantonly violated by the hostile acts of the U.S. and its allies.
					
					 The third underground nuclear test conducted by the DPRK recently was its exercise of the right to self-defense as it was aimed to meet the blatant challenge of hostile forces escalating their anti-DPRK confrontation racket over its space development for peaceful purposes and defend the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 In the wake of the DPRK's third underground nuclear test, the U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces have made desperate efforts to realize their scenario for mounting a preemptive nuclear attack on it, talking about "additional provocation" and crying out for "establishing a posture for strong military counteractions ".
					
					 Now that the south Korean puppet regime is working hard to perpetrate provocations against the DPRK, making the provocation of a nuclear war a fait accompli, it is quite natural for the DPRK to bolster up war deterrent in every way in order to defend the sovereignty and preserve the peace and security on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Inviolable is the DPRK's right to sovereignty.
					
					 If the U.S. and its allies persist in their hostile approaches in the future, too, they will not be able to escape the DPRK's merciless retaliatory actions.
					
					 The Korean people will surely win a final victory as they are advancing along the road of independence, convinced of their just cause.

articles.title: Minju Joson U.S. Termed Arch Criminal Escalating Tensions on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
Minju Joson U.S. Termed Arch Criminal Escalating Tensions on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is letting loose a spate of invectives that the third nuclear test of the DPRK is "a violation of the UN Security Council's resolution" and "a provocation threatening global peace and security".
					 Minju Joson Sunday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK regard these remarks as nothing but jargon of those bereft of discretion and reason, blinded by the hostile policy toward the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK's third underground nuclear test was not aimed to threaten anyone or wreck peace.
					
					 By nature, the DPRK had neither a plan to conduct the nuclear test nor need to do so. 
					
					 The U.S., however, deterred the DPRK from focusing its efforts on developing the economy and improving the standard of people's living under the peaceful and stable circumstances. Such ill intention of the U.S. was concentrically manifested when the DPRK launched satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2 in December last year. 
					
					 The satellite launch was an exercise of the legitimate right of a sovereign state under international law.
					
					 But the U.S. pulled up the DPRK only over its satellite launch. It has desperately worked to put international pressure on the DPRK, seizing it as a golden opportunity for stepping up its hostile policy toward the latter.
					
					 The DPRK was compelled to make an important decision under the grim situation where the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK entered a grave phase and the DPRK was barred from staging in peace a drive for developing the economy and improving the standard of people's living. This was the very reason why it conducted the third underground nuclear test.
					
					 The U.S. is to blame for the situation on the Korean Peninsula inching close to an unpredictable phase.

articles.title: Minju Joson Ridicules Departing Lee Myung Bak's Speech
articles.content:
Minju Joson Ridicules Departing Lee Myung Bak's Speech
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea on Feb. 19 made a speech before leaving his office. 
					 Minju Joson Sunday in a bylined commentary ridicules this as a disgusting speech made by a man more dead than alive before going to his grave and poor self-praise. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 In his "speech" Lee did not forget to take issue with the DPRK's successful satellite launch and nuclear test, a clear indication of his utter ignorance of it. 
					
					 "Change in the behavior of inhabitants in the north" and "consistent principle towards the north afterwards" touted by Lee are nothing but shameless balderdash intended to justify the crimes Lee has committed by bringing the north-south relations to a collapse. 
					
					 It is the height of impudence that Lee made such self-praise of his 5-year office as describing it "as a worthwhile and glorious period."
					
					 Lurking behind his speech was a sinister intention to justify all his crimes during the five years' office and let the next regime carry forward his "exploits" in a bid to escape a severe punishment after his ouster. 
					
					 But, no one would lend ear to his foolish and poor speech. 
					
					 It will only invite denunciation and ridicule from people from all walks of life. 
					
					 Lee will have to painfully regret for all crimes committed during his office. 
					
					 He is fated to meet a miserable end.

articles.title: Foreigners Visit DPRK Missions on Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Foreigners Visit DPRK Missions on Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Personages of Bangladesh, Nepal, China, Democratic Congo, Nigeria and Austria visited the DPRK missions in their countries from Jan. 28 to Feb. 16 to mark the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Among them were the chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Bangladesh, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Bangladesh Communist Party, president of the Bangladesh People's League, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, chairman of the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Committee, chairman and general secretary of the Nepal Council for World Studies, chairman of the Beijing Xinwei Telecom Enterprise Group of China, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party, general secretary of the People's Rally for Socialism and chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of Democratic Congo, chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association who is member of the Credit Committee of the People's Democratic Party and the chairman o
					
					 f the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea.
					
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before full-length pictures depicting  President Kim Il Sung and general secretary Kim Jong Il standing together and their portraits and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: DPRK People Enjoy Full Moon Day
articles.content:
DPRK People Enjoy Full Moon Day
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Full Moon Day, which falls on February 24 this year, is one of the traditional holidays for the Koreans.
					 People in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea enjoyed the day pleasantly, delighted with the recent successful third nuclear test.
					
					 Restaurants throughout the country, including Okryu and Chongryu restaurants in Pyongyang and Sinhung Restaurant in Hamhung, served varieties of special national dishes.
					
					 People took noodles and dishes made of nine kinds of dried edible herbs, while playing such folklore amusement games as Korean chess and yut-game with family members, relatives and neighbors.
					
					 As it is getting dark, citizens are seen enjoying the first full moon on Moran Hill and banks of the River Taedong in Pyongyang, Inphung Pavilion in Kanggye, Yaksandongdae in Nyongbyon and other scenic spots of the country.
					
					 Kim Nam Sik, a 54-year-old man who climbed Moran Hill to see the full moon, told KCNA:
					
					 "From olden times, the Koreans would tell their desire for the year to the first full moon, wishing that their desire would come into reality.
					
					 It is my desire that the DPRK, a satellite manufacturing and launching state and a full-fledged nuclear state, always remains as a powerful nation any other countries dare not provoke."

articles.title: Day of Shining Star Marked by Foreign Newspapers
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star Marked by Foreign Newspapers
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Foreign newspapers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 Paper of Uruguay La Juventud on Feb. 7 carried articles accompanied with a portrait of Kim Jong Il and a photo of Kimjongilia.
					
					 The paper said in an article titled "Kim Jong Il, Leader of People" as follows:
					
					 The life of Kim Jong Il was a brilliant one devoted to the people's happiness, prosperity of socialist Korea and the cause of global independence.
					
					 Love for people was the core of Kim Jong Il's personality.
					
					 It was his view that a revolution was aimed to bring love for people into full bloom.
					
					 The wishes and interests of the people were the standard and starting point of all his thoughts and practice and their realization was regarded as the most important affair to be settled under any circumstances.
					
					 People's happiness was his greatest pleasure.
					
					 The February issue of German Paper Rote Fahne carried an article illustrated with a portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It said the untimely demise of Kim Jong Il, a great leader and revolutionary, meant a great loss for the cause of global independence. 
					
					 He developed and enriched the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 The achievements made in the DPRK, including the successful launch of satellite Kwangmyongsong 3-2, are the precious fruition of the Songun politics pursued by him.
					
					 The Ethiopian paper Daily Monitor on Feb. 8 devoted its one whole page to articles praising his ideological and theoretical feats illustrated with his photo.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary Celebrated in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Events took place in different countries from Feb. 4 to 11 to celebrate the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 They included a friendship gathering in Cambodia, round-table talks in Dominica, film shows in Romania, Senegal and Ethiopia and photo and book exhibition and film show in Uganda.
					
					 Participants of the film shows watched Korean films including "Old Home in Mt. Paektu Shining with Glory" and "Reply of Korea."
					
					 Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the Socialist Party of Romania, praised Kim Jong Il as the greatest man.
					
					 Thanks to his wise leadership the DPRK turned into an invincible socialist power, the chairman said.
					
					 A deputy director of the Ministry of City Planning of Senegal lauded the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, noting the drive of the Korean army and people to face-lift the country is an example to be followed by Senegalese.
					
					 The acting executive secretary of the Ugandan National Women's Council and other speakers praised Kim Jong Il as a peerlessly elder statesman as he turned socialist Korea into a matchless politico-military power with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 A minister of state of Cambodia sincerely hoped that the Korean people, single-mindedly united around the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, would register successes in their efforts to achieve the prosperity and reunification of the country and defend its sovereignty.

articles.title: Political Parties in Benin, Poland Hail DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test
articles.content:
Political Parties in Benin, Poland Hail DPRK's Successful Nuclear Test
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Benin and Polish political parties made public statements on Feb. 13 and 14 hailing the DPRK's successful third underground nuclear test.
					 The Socialist Party of Benin said:
					
					 The third underground nuclear test conducted by the DPRK was entirely just reaction to the illegal "resolution on sanctions" against it cooked up by the UN Security Council.
					
					 The DPRK's launch of satellite is a peaceful activity for developing the economy and improving the people's living standard, to all intents and purposes.
					
					 However, the U.S. and its followers termed the satellite launch "long-range missile launch" and "grave challenge" to global peace and security.
					
					 It is natural for the DPRK to bolster its nuclear deterrence to cope with it as it launched an all-out showdown to defend the sovereignty of the country and nation.
					
					 The Socialist Party of Benin warmly hails the successful third underground nuclear test and extends solidarity to the Workers' Party of Korea and the people of the DPRK in their just cause.
					
					 The Polish Communist Party said:
					
					 When the DPRK launched its satellite in December last year, the Western media undisguisedly accused this and the UN cooked up "a resolution on sanctions" against it. 
					
					 The DPRK conducted the third underground nuclear test to protect its independent right provided by international law.
					
					 The world progressives are extending support to the Korean people in the efforts to protect the sovereignty, dignity, peace and stability of the country and nation by their own strength.

articles.title: Tablet to Honour Kim Jong Il Unveiled in Russia
articles.content:
Tablet to Honour Kim Jong Il Unveiled in Russia
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- A tablet to honour general secretary Kim Jong Il was fixed to a wall of Gaban Hotel in Vladivostok, Russia.
					 Engraved on it are "Comrade Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and Generalissimo of the DPRK, paid an official visit to the Far East Federal Region of the Russian Federation and stayed at Gaban Hotel on August 23, 2002."
					
					 A ceremony for unveiling the tablet took place on Feb. 20.
					
					 Present there were officials of the Legislative Assembly of the Maritime Territory of Russia, the mission of the Foreign Ministry in Vladivostok, the Vladivostok City Assembly and political parties and organizations of the maritime territory, those who had the honour to be received by Kim Jong Il, masses and the consul general and staff members of the DPRK consulate general in Nakhodka. 
					
					 The chairman of the Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism in the Far East Region made an address.
					
					 The first secretary of the Maritime Territory Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the director general of Gaban Hotel and the DPRK consul general in Nakhodka unveiled the tablet.
					
					 After it was unveiled, the participants laid floral baskets, bouquets and flowers before it.
					
					 Then followed speeches.
					
					 The participants watched a Korean film dealing with Kim Jong Il's visit to the Far East Region of Russia.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Foreign personages praised the exploits leader Kim Jong Il performed for the human cause of independence on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il. Personages of China, Democratic Congo and Nigeria visited the DPRK missions in their countries.
					 The chairman of the Beijing Xinwei Telecom Enterprise Group of China said:
					
					 We remember Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, in deep reverence on the occasion of his birth anniversary.
					
					 He was a great man who dedicated everything to the building of a thriving socialist nation, happiness of the Korean people and the Sino-DPRK friendship.
					
					 Unshakable is our determination to support the Korean people in their cause, true to his behest.
					
					 The general secretary of the Communist Party of Democratic Congo noted that the great feats Kim Jong Il performed for the accomplishment of the human cause of independence will shine forever along with the Juche idea, Songun idea.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers are kicking up a desperate campaign against the DPRK over its satellite launch for peaceful purposes and nuclear test for self-defence but they will not escape a defeat in face of the might of Songun, the general secretary added.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association praised Kim Jong Il as a peerlessly great man who performed undying feats on behalf of the times and history with his outstanding ideology and leadership.
					
					 He defended and advanced the country and the revolution, smashing the anti-DPRK moves of the imperialists with his Songun revolutionary leadership, the chairman said, stressing that this constitutes distinguished feats performed by him for the cause of global independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Austria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Austria
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- General secretary Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Socialist State of Juche with Invincible Might" was brought out in pamphlet by the Joseph Gebauer Publishing House in Vienna, Austria on February 14.
					 The work, made public on September 5, Juche 97 (2008), clarifies in detail that the invincible might of the DPRK lies in defending and eternally glorifying President Kim Il Sung's Juche-oriented idea of nation building and his exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Italian Political Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Feats Lauded by Italian Political Figure
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Osvaldo Pesce, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Unified Communist Party of Italy, on Feb. 13 made public a statement titled "Exploits of Great Leader Kim Jong Il" to mark the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 He said in the statement:
					
					 The international community highly praises Kim Jong Il as a great leader of the Korean people and recollects with deep emotion his immortal feats performed for the human cause of independence and the Korean people's happiness.
					
					 Kim Jong Il formulated the revolutionary idea of President Kim Il Sung as a monolithic system of Juche-oriented ideology, theory and method.
					
					 His work "On the Juche Idea" serves as a beacon of hope for the world progressive parties and people aspiring after socialism and a textbook of their struggle.
					
					 Kim Jong Il steadily developed the Juche idea as required by the developing times and revolution.
					
					 His Songun politics is based on the Juche idea.
					
					 Thanks to the great Songun politics, the Korean people could reliably protect the country's sovereignty and the gains of the revolution despite the imperialists' political and military pressure and make laudable achievements in the drive to build a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un formulated the revolutionary idea of the preceding leaders as Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Bulletins Released by Foreign Organizations to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
articles.content:
Bulletins Released by Foreign Organizations to Mark Kim Jong Il's Birth Anniversary
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Foreign organizations published bulletins to celebrate Feb. 16, the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star).
					 The Group of Youth for the Study of Kim Jong Il Juche Idea in Vienna, Austria carried an article in its bulletin under the caption of "On Occasion of 71st Anniversary of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il" illustrated with a portrait of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The article said Kim Jong Il was born in Mt. Paektu on Feb. 16, 1942, and grew up in the crucible of the anti-Japanese war and the Fatherland Liberation War (Korean War).
					
					 Kim Jong Il displayed outstanding leadership art, while working at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 As a prominent thinker and theoretician, he steadily developed the Juche idea founded by President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Late in the 20th century, the Korean people had Kim Jong Il at the helm of the revolution, weathering out all difficulties and trials. 
					
					 Thanks to Kim Jong Il's Songun politics, the DPRK could defeat the U.S. and its followers' moves to stifle it and defend the sovereignty of the country.
					
					 The Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association carried in its bulletin articles titled "Snow and Kim Jong Il", "Man of the Year Kim Jong Un", etc.
					
					 Kim Jong Il dedicated himself to the prosperity of the country and its people's happiness all his life, said the articles, adding the Korean people and the world progressives would always remember his brilliant life.
					
					 The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea carried in its bulletin an article praising the ideological and theoretical exploits of Kim Jong Il, who indicated the road to be followed by humankind in the era of independence through his outstanding ideological and theoretical activities.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian, Polish Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Russian, Polish Organizations
 Pyongyang, February 24 (KCNA) -- Russian and Polish organizations posted special write-ups on their Internet homepages on Feb. 15 and 16 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of general secretary Kim Jong Il.
					 The Young Communist League of Russia and the Rostov－Na－Donu Anti－Bourgeois Front posted articles illustrated with photos on the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They praised the dear respected Kim Jong Un for his wise leadership over the work for glorifying the sacred revolutionary life and immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and the invincibility of Songun Korea.
					
					 The Moscow Workers' Union of Russia posted an article titled "On Occasion of Birth Anniversary of Comrade Kim Jong Il, Exploits Performed for Cause of Socialism".
					
					 One of the greatest exploits he performed for the cause of socialism was that he protected the destiny of socialism, the article said, adding:
					
					 Late in the 20th century, Kim Jong Il formulated the Songun politics as a main political mode and thoroughly applied it to protect the socialism of the DPRK from the imperialist allied forces' general offensive. 
					
					 He also ushered in a period of surge in the cause of socialism.
					
					 The Polish branch of the Korean Friendship Association posted an article saying:
					
					 Generalissimo Kim Jong Il devoted everything to the people's happiness.
					
					 His Songun politics helped develop the Korean People's Army into an invincible force capable of defending the dignity and sovereignty of the country and its people.
					
					 The Songun politics has ensured the peace and stability of the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Thanks to Kim Jong Il's wise leadership, the DPRK turned into a nuclear power capable of frustrating all sorts of moves of enemies against it.
					
					 He made great contributions to the cause of independence against imperialism and global peace and security.
